subject: Law
title: Civil Disobedience
description: A quick win: understand Civil Disobedience.

hook.text: Rosa Parks broke the law by sitting in a white-only bus seat. She was arrested. History calls her a hero.

buildup.text: Civil disobedience is the deliberate, nonviolent breaking of a law to protest injustice and demand change.

discovery.text: Thoreau, Gandhi, and King all argued that disobeying unjust laws is a moral duty‚Äînot a crime.

twist.text: Civil disobedience accepts legal punishment. That willingness to suffer consequences gives it moral authority.

climax.text: Modern movements from climate protests to racial justice use civil disobedience‚Äîand face the same legal risks.

punchline.text: Sometimes breaking the law is the most lawful thing you can do.

quiz.question: What distinguishes civil disobedience from ordinary lawbreaking?
options: It's deliberate, nonviolent, and accepts legal consequences
